verbs.description: dere (third-person singular simple present deres, present participle dering, simple past and past participle dered)

entries.meaning: (transitive, UK, archaic, dialectal) To hurt; harm; injure; wound.
(transitive, UK dialectal) To annoy, trouble, grieve.

description: Nonstandard spelling of there, reflecting any of a variety of accents with th-stopping.
